title: Romans Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Romans chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Romans Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Romans Chapter 10.

questions.question: What is Paul's heart's desire and prayer to God for Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: That they might be saved
questions.explanation: Romans 10:1 states that Paul's heart's desire and prayer to God for Israel is that they might be saved.

questions.question: According to Romans 10:2, what kind of zeal do the Israelites have?
options: A zeal of God, but not according to knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: A zeal of God, but not according to knowledge
questions.explanation: Romans 10:2 explains that they have a zeal of God, but not according to knowledge.

questions.question: According to Romans 10:3, what were the Israelites trying to establish instead of submitting to God's righteousness?
questions.correctAnswer: Their own righteousness
questions.explanation: Romans 10:3 says they were going about to establish their own righteousness and did not submit to God's righteousness.

questions.question: Who is described as the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ
questions.explanation: Romans 10:4 states that Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone that believes.

questions.question: According to Romans 10:5, who shall live by doing the things described by Moses?
options: The man which doeth those things
The preacher sent to the people
The one who confesses with the mouth
questions.correctAnswer: The man which doeth those things
questions.explanation: Romans 10:5 says that the man which doeth those things shall live by them.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into ______? (that is, to bring Christ down from above:)'
questions.correctAnswer: heaven
questions.explanation: Romans 10:6 says not to say in your heart, 'Who shall ascend into heaven?' referring to bringing Christ down from above.

questions.question: According to Romans 10:7, what question is posed about bringing Christ up again?
options: Who shall descend into the deep?
Who shall call upon the Lord?
questions.correctAnswer: Who shall descend into the deep?
questions.explanation: Romans 10:7 asks, 'Who shall descend into the deep?' meaning to bring up Christ again from the dead.

questions.question: Where is the word of faith said to be, according to Romans 10:8?
options: In thy mouth and in thy heart
questions.correctAnswer: In thy mouth and in thy heart
questions.explanation: Romans 10:8 says the word is nigh thee, even in thy mouth and in thy heart.

questions.question: What must a person do to be saved, according to Romans 10:9?
options: Confess with the mouth the Lord Jesus and believe in the heart that God raised him from the dead
Follow the law of Moses perfectly
questions.correctAnswer: Confess with the mouth the Lord Jesus and believe in the heart that God raised him from the dead
questions.explanation: Romans 10:9 teaches that confessing Jesus as Lord and believing in His resurrection leads to salvation.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 10:11 states that whoever believes in Him will be ashamed.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Romans 10:11 says whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

questions.question: According to Romans 10:12, what is said about the difference between the Jew and the Greek?
questions.correctAnswer: There is no difference
questions.explanation: Romans 10:12 states there is no difference between Jew and Greek for the same Lord is rich unto all that call upon him.

questions.question: Who shall be saved according to Romans 10:13?
options: Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord
questions.explanation: Romans 10:13 promises salvation to whosoever calls upon the name of the Lord.

questions.question: True or False: According to Romans 10:14, people can call on Him if they have not believed or heard about Him.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Romans 10:14 explains that people cannot call on Him if they have not believed or heard about Him.

questions.question: Who must be sent in order to preach, according to Romans 10:15?
questions.correctAnswer: Those who are sent
questions.explanation: Romans 10:15 says how can they preach except they be sent.

questions.question: True or False: According to Romans 10:17, faith comes by hearing and hearing by the word of God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Romans 10:17 clearly states that faith cometh by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.

medium.title: Romans Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Romans Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with doubt about salvation. Based on Romans 10, what biblical truth would you share about confessing faith?
options: If you confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus and believe in your heart that God raised Him, you shall be saved.
Salvation depends solely on doing good works perfectly.
Only those who strictly follow the law can be saved.
Salvation is guaranteed without faith or confession.
questions.correctAnswer: If you confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus and believe in your heart that God raised Him, you shall be saved.
questions.explanation: Romans 10:9-10 teaches that salvation comes through confessing Jesus as Lord and believing in resurrection, highlighting the importance of faith and confession for righteousness and salvation.

questions.question: According to Romans 10, how does faith come to a person?
options: Faith comes by hearing the word of God.
Faith comes by observing religious rituals.
Faith comes by self-effort and good deeds.
questions.correctAnswer: Faith comes by hearing the word of God.
questions.explanation: Romans 10:17 clearly states that faith comes by hearing the message of Christ, emphasizing the importance of the preached word in developing faith.

questions.question: How does Romans 10 teach us about the importance of evangelism?
options: Preachers must be sent to proclaim the gospel so people can hear and believe.
Evangelism is optional and not necessary for salvation.
People can believe without ever hearing the gospel.
Preaching the gospel is only for the apostles.
questions.correctAnswer: Preachers must be sent to proclaim the gospel so people can hear and believe.
questions.explanation: Romans 10:14-15 emphasizes that people cannot believe in Jesus without hearing the gospel, and preaching requires being sent, showing the vital role of evangelism.

questions.question: What does Romans 10 say about the relationship between the law and Christ?
options: Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes.
Christ abolished the law and it no longer matters.
The law alone without Christ grants righteousness.
Believers must keep the law perfectly to be righteous.
questions.correctAnswer: Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes.
questions.explanation: Romans 10:4 teaches that Christ fulfills the law and brings righteousness to all who believe, shifting focus from law-keeping to faith in Christ.

questions.question: A believer is confused about how to attain righteousness. Based on Romans 10, what should they understand?
options: Righteousness comes through faith, not by trying to establish your own.
Righteousness comes by strictly following the law without faith.
Righteousness is earned by works and rituals.
Righteousness is not necessary for salvation.
questions.correctAnswer: Righteousness comes through faith, not by trying to establish your own.
questions.explanation: Romans 10:3 explains that trying to establish one's own righteousness ignores God's righteousness, which comes through faith, highlighting submission to God's righteousness.

questions.question: According to Romans 10, what is the role of the heart and mouth in salvation?
options: Believing with the heart leads to righteousness, and confessing with the mouth leads to salvation.
Only the heart matters; the mouth confession is unnecessary.
Only mouth confession matters; heart belief is irrelevant.
Neither heart belief nor mouth confession affects salvation.
questions.correctAnswer: Believing with the heart leads to righteousness, and confessing with the mouth leads to salvation.
questions.explanation: Romans 10:10 teaches that heart belief brings righteousness, while confession with the mouth results in salvation, showing the necessity of both faith and confession.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 10 teaches that there is a difference between Jews and Greeks in who can receive salvation.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Romans 10:12 states there is no difference between Jew and Greek; the same Lord is rich to all who call upon Him, emphasizing the universal offer of salvation.

questions.question: True or False: According to Romans 10, zeal for God without knowledge leads to submission to God's righteousness.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Romans 10:2-3 explains that zeal without knowledge leads to ignorance of God's righteousness and failure to submit to it, showing that knowledge and faith must accompany zeal.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Romans 10 teaches that the word of faith is "nigh thee, even in thy mouth, and in thy _____."
questions.correctAnswer: heart
questions.explanation: Romans 10:8 states the word of faith is near, in the mouth and in the heart, indicating the accessibility of faith and confession.

questions.question: What does Romans 10 reveal about God's attitude toward disobedient people like Israel?
options: God stretches out His hands all day long to them, showing His desire for their repentance.
God punishes disobedient people without hope.
God ignores disobedient people and focuses on others.
questions.correctAnswer: God stretches out His hands all day long to them, showing His desire for their repentance.
questions.explanation: Romans 10:21 describes God stretching out His hands to Israel despite their disobedience, illustrating His patience and longing for their return.

questions.question: How does Romans 10 encourage believers to view the availability of salvation?
options: Salvation is available to everyone who calls on the name of the Lord.
Salvation is only for a select few.
Salvation is limited to those born into the covenant.
questions.correctAnswer: Salvation is available to everyone who calls on the name of the Lord.
questions.explanation: Romans 10:13 emphasizes that whoever calls on the Lord will be saved, highlighting the open invitation to all people.

questions.question: How does Romans 10 describe the zeal of Israel for God?
options: They have zeal, but not according to knowledge.
They have no zeal for God.
Their zeal is perfect and fully informed.
Their zeal is for other gods.
questions.correctAnswer: They have zeal, but not according to knowledge.
questions.explanation: Romans 10:2 states that Israel has zeal for God but it is misguided due to lack of true knowledge, which affects their obedience.

questions.question: Based on Romans 10, what is the significance of preaching the gospel?
options: Preaching is necessary so people can hear, believe, and call on the Lord for salvation.
Preaching is optional and not essential for salvation.
Preaching is only for those already believers.
Preaching should be done only by the apostles.
questions.correctAnswer: Preaching is necessary so people can hear, believe, and call on the Lord for salvation.
questions.explanation: Romans 10:14-15 explains that people must hear the gospel to believe and call on the Lord, making preaching essential for salvation.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged by the difficulty of living by the law. According to Romans 10, what hope is given?
options: Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes.
The law must be perfectly kept to find hope.
There is no hope outside the law.
Hope comes through human effort alone.
questions.correctAnswer: Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes.
questions.explanation: Romans 10:4 offers hope by showing that Christ fulfills the law and grants righteousness through faith, relieving the burden of perfect law-keeping.

questions.question: How does Romans 10 address the universal reach of the gospel message?
options: Their sound has gone out into all the earth, and their words to the ends of the world.
The gospel is only for Israel.
The gospel is hidden and unknown to most people.
The gospel is limited to certain languages.
questions.correctAnswer: Their sound has gone out into all the earth, and their words to the ends of the world.
questions.explanation: Romans 10:18 affirms that the message of God has been proclaimed worldwide, showing the wide reach of the gospel.

hard.title: Romans Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Romans Chapter 10.

questions.question: According to Romans 10:4, what is the role of Christ in relation to the law?
options: Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone that believes
Christ upholds the law perfectly for all
Christ abolishes the law without replacement
Christ is a teacher of the law's requirements
questions.correctAnswer: Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone that believes
questions.explanation: Romans 10:4 states that Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone that believes, signifying fulfillment and completion of the law's purpose.

questions.question: What does Romans 10:9 say is necessary for salvation?
options: Confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus and believe in your heart that God raised Him from the dead
Follow all the laws of Moses perfectly
Offer sacrifices as prescribed in the law
questions.correctAnswer: Confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus and believe in your heart that God raised Him from the dead
questions.explanation: Romans 10:9 explains that confessing Jesus as Lord and believing in His resurrection is the requirement for salvation.

questions.question: In Romans 10:2, what is the nature of Israel's zeal according to Paul?
options: Zeal of God, but not according to knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: Zeal of God, but not according to knowledge
questions.explanation: Romans 10:2 highlights that Israel's zeal is genuine but misguided due to lack of true knowledge of God's righteousness.

questions.question: What rhetorical question in Romans 10:6-7 is used to illustrate the accessibility of faith?
options: Who shall ascend into heaven or descend into the deep?
Who can keep the law perfectly?
Who will offer sacrifices for sin?
Who is worthy to enter the temple?
questions.correctAnswer: Who shall ascend into heaven or descend into the deep?
questions.explanation: Romans 10:6-7 uses these rhetorical questions to emphasize that righteousness by faith does not require impossible acts like bringing Christ down from heaven or up from the dead.

questions.question: How does Romans 10:12 describe the Lord's attitude toward Jew and Greek?
options: There is no difference; the Lord is rich to all who call upon Him
The Lord favors the Jew over the Greek
The Lord favors the Greek over the Jew
The Lord judges the Jew and Greek separately
questions.correctAnswer: There is no difference; the Lord is rich to all who call upon Him
questions.explanation: Romans 10:12 states that God shows no partiality between Jew and Greek and offers His riches to all who call on Him.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'the word is nigh thee, even in thy mouth, and in thy heart' in Romans 10:8?
options: It indicates the accessibility of the message of faith
It suggests the word is hidden and unreachable
It refers to secret knowledge for the elite
It means the word is only for the priests
questions.correctAnswer: It indicates the accessibility of the message of faith
questions.explanation: Romans 10:8 emphasizes that the word of faith is near and accessible, available to be confessed and believed by anyone.

questions.question: Which Old Testament prophet is quoted in Romans 10:16 and 10:20 to highlight Israel's unbelief?
questions.correctAnswer: Isaiah
questions.explanation: Romans 10:16 and 10:20 quote Isaiah (Esaias) to underscore Israel's rejection of the gospel message.

questions.question: What literary device is prominent in Romans 10:6-8, especially in the structure of the questions and answers?
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm
questions.explanation: Romans 10:6-8 shows a chiastic structure, where the questions about ascending and descending frame the central statement about the word being near.

questions.question: Romans 10:14 asks how people can call on Him if they have not believed. What does this highlight about the necessity of what?
options: Preaching and hearing the gospel message
questions.correctAnswer: Preaching and hearing the gospel message
questions.explanation: Romans 10:14 stresses the necessity of preaching and hearing for faith to arise, as belief precedes calling on the Lord.

questions.question: What does Paul mean by stating 'Christ is the end of the law' in Romans 10:4?
options: Christ fulfills and completes the law's purpose
Christ abolishes the law with no replacement
questions.correctAnswer: Christ fulfills and completes the law's purpose
questions.explanation: In Romans 10:4, 'end' (Greek: telos) means goal or fulfillment, indicating Christ brings the law to its intended completion.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 10:17 teaches that faith comes by hearing the word of God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Romans 10:17 clearly states faith comes from hearing, and hearing by the word of God, affirming the importance of proclamation.

questions.question: Romans 10:5 contrasts righteousness of the law with righteousness of faith. What Old Testament figure is used to describe righteousness by law?
questions.correctAnswer: Moses
questions.explanation: Romans 10:5 references Moses who describes the righteousness of the law as the one who does these commands will live by them.

questions.question: In Romans 10:19, Paul quotes Moses saying God will provoke Israel to jealousy by a people who are what?
options: Not a people and a foolish nation
questions.correctAnswer: Not a people and a foolish nation
questions.explanation: Romans 10:19 quotes Moses about God provoking Israel's jealousy by those 'not a people' and a 'foolish nation', indicating Gentile inclusion.

questions.question: What does Romans 10:21 reveal about Israel's response to God's outreach?
options: Israel is disobedient and gainsaying despite God's continual offer
Israel is unaware of God's attempts
questions.correctAnswer: Israel is disobedient and gainsaying despite God's continual offer
questions.explanation: Romans 10:21 states God has stretched out His hands all day to a disobedient and gainsaying people, indicating rejection.

questions.question: What is the significance of 'how beautiful are the feet of them that preach the gospel' in Romans 10:15?
options: It expresses the value and honor of those who bring the gospel message
It criticizes the messengers of the gospel
It demands that preachers wear sandals
questions.correctAnswer: It expresses the value and honor of those who bring the gospel message
questions.explanation: Romans 10:15 quotes Isaiah to highlight the honor and joy associated with messengers who bring good news and peace.

theological.title: Romans Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Romans Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What is Paul's heartfelt desire and prayer to God concerning Israel according to Romans 10:1?
options: That they might receive the law
That they might conquer their enemies
questions.correctAnswer: That they might be saved
questions.explanation: Romans 10:1 clearly states Paul's heart's desire and prayer is for Israel's salvation, emphasizing God's mercy and calling as also seen in Ezekiel 36:26-27, Jeremiah 31:33-34, and John 3:16.

questions.question: According to Romans 10:2, how is Israel's zeal described?
options: Zeal of God but not according to knowledge
Zeal that leads to perfect obedience
questions.correctAnswer: Zeal of God but not according to knowledge
questions.explanation: Romans 10:2 states Israel’s zeal is for God but it lacks true knowledge, reflecting a theme of misguided zeal similar to Acts 22:3 and Galatians 1:13 where zeal without understanding is cautioned.

questions.question: What does Romans 10:3 say Israel was trying to establish, which led to their ignorance of God's righteousness?
questions.correctAnswer: Their own righteousness
questions.explanation: Romans 10:3 explains Israel sought to establish their own righteousness rather than submitting to God's righteousness, a contrast echoed in Isaiah 64:6 and Philippians 3:9 emphasizing human inability to achieve divine righteousness.

questions.question: What does Paul say in Romans 10:4 about Christ's relation to the law?
options: Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes
Christ fulfilled only the ceremonial law
Christ is a teacher of the law
questions.correctAnswer: Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes
questions.explanation: Romans 10:4 states Christ is the culmination or goal of the law, bringing righteousness to believers, consistent with Matthew 5:17-18, Galatians 3:24, and Hebrews 7:19 which show Christ fulfilling the law's purpose.

questions.question: According to Romans 10:5, what did Moses say about righteousness under the law?
options: The man which doeth those things shall live by them
Righteousness is by faith apart from works
The law is a shadow of good things to come
No one can attain righteousness by the law
questions.correctAnswer: The man which doeth those things shall live by them
questions.explanation: Romans 10:5 quotes Moses emphasizing obedience to the law as the basis for life, reflecting Leviticus 18:5 and Deuteronomy 30:15-20, highlighting the law's demand for perfect obedience.

questions.question: What does the righteousness of faith instruct believers not to do, according to Romans 10:6?
options: Say in your heart, Who shall ascend into heaven?
Trust in works of the law
questions.correctAnswer: Say in your heart, Who shall ascend into heaven?
questions.explanation: Romans 10:6 teaches that righteousness by faith does not require impossible tasks like bringing Christ down from heaven, pointing to faith's accessibility as emphasized in John 3:14-18 and Hebrews 4:14-16.

questions.question: In Romans 10:7, what question does the righteousness of faith reject?
options: Who shall descend into the deep?
Who is worthy of the kingdom?
Who can keep the law perfectly?
questions.correctAnswer: Who shall descend into the deep?
questions.explanation: Romans 10:7 rejects the idea that one must bring Christ up from the dead, affirming Christ’s resurrection as a completed work, consistent with 1 Corinthians 15:20-23 and Acts 2:24.

questions.question: According to Romans 10:8, where is the word of faith that Paul preaches found?
options: In your mouth and in your heart
questions.correctAnswer: In your mouth and in your heart
questions.explanation: Romans 10:8 states the word of faith is near, in one's mouth and heart, indicating personal confession and belief, aligning with Deuteronomy 30:14 and John 1:12.

questions.question: What two actions are required for salvation according to Romans 10:9?
options: Confess with your mouth and believe in your heart
Follow the law and give offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Confess with your mouth and believe in your heart
questions.explanation: Romans 10:9 teaches salvation comes through confessing Jesus as Lord and believing in His resurrection, consistent with Matthew 10:32-33, John 20:31, and Acts 16:31.

questions.question: What does Romans 10:10 say happens with the heart and mouth in relation to salvation?
options: Belief in the heart leads to righteousness; confession with the mouth leads to salvation
Righteousness comes from works; confession is optional
Salvation is by law; faith is secondary
Only confession is necessary without belief
questions.correctAnswer: Belief in the heart leads to righteousness; confession with the mouth leads to salvation
questions.explanation: Romans 10:10 emphasizes internal belief producing righteousness and external confession resulting in salvation, paralleling Proverbs 23:7, Isaiah 6:10, and James 2:19.

questions.question: According to Romans 10:12, what is said about the difference between Jew and Greek in God's eyes?
options: There is no difference; the same Lord is rich to all who call on Him
questions.correctAnswer: There is no difference; the same Lord is rich to all who call on Him
questions.explanation: Romans 10:12 teaches God's impartiality, consistent with Acts 10:34-35, Galatians 3:28, and Colossians 3:11 affirming one new humanity in Christ.

questions.question: What promise is given in Romans 10:13 for everyone who calls upon the name of the Lord?
questions.correctAnswer: Shall be saved
questions.explanation: Romans 10:13 promises salvation to all who call on the Lord, echoing Joel 2:32, Acts 2:21, and 1 Corinthians 1:2 highlighting God's gracious offer of salvation to all.

questions.question: According to Romans 10:14, what is necessary before people can call on the Lord?
options: They must hear, believe, and be preached to
They must follow the law perfectly
questions.correctAnswer: They must hear, believe, and be preached to
questions.explanation: Romans 10:14 highlights the necessity of hearing the gospel through preaching before one can believe and call on the Lord, consistent with Isaiah 52:7 and Luke 24:47.

questions.question: How does Romans 10:15 describe the feet of those who preach the gospel of peace?
questions.correctAnswer: Beautiful
questions.explanation: Romans 10:15 quotes Isaiah 52:7 praising the beauty of feet that bring good news, illustrating the honor and blessing upon gospel messengers as seen in Nahum 1:15 and Acts 13:32.

questions.question: What does Romans 10:17 say is the source of faith?
questions.correctAnswer: Hearing the word of God
questions.explanation: Romans 10:17 teaches that faith arises from hearing God's word, aligning with John 20:31, Hebrews 11:1, and Acts 16:14 demonstrating the power of the proclaimed gospel.
